required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Analysis Into the Cause and Preventional Method of Thromboembolic Disease in Gynecological Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: An Analysis Into the Cause and Preventional Method of Thromboembolic Disease in Gynecological Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this cross-sectional study is to describe the specific sutuations of thromboembolic disease in gynecological surgery and identify the risk factors of it.

detailed_description.textblock: The electronic medical data of 54 patients who undergo operations to treat gynecological diseases but develop thromboembolic disease will be analyzed retrospectively in this study. The location, symptom and other situations of embolism will be described and multiple linear analysi will be employed to identify the risk factors of it.

primary_outcome.measure: the percentage of different symptoms of thromboembolic disease(%)
primary_outcome.description: different patiens will have various symptoms of embolism like dyspnea, chest pain, hemoptysis and syncope. And we plan to describe the distribution of it.

secondary_outcome.description: embolisom can occur in different parts like the brain, limb, pulmonary and coronary systems. We plan to summarize the location of embolism.

secondary_outcome.measure: the risk factors of thromboembolic disease
secondary_outcome.description: Performing multiple linear regression analysis with SPSS 17.0, we plan to identify the risk factors which can increase the possibility of thromboembolic disease from possible factors like hypertension, diabetes, etc.

arm_group.description: the patients who undergo gynecological operations but develop thromboembolic disease

study_pop.textblock: The planned sample size was based on data from a previous study, in which the standard deviation was 5. We assumed an one-tailed Î± error of 0.05 and a sampling error of 1.0. we propose to enroll 60 participants and allow for a dropout rate of 10% for an effective sample size of 54.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan
